result.execSummary:
The defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $60.00 to Kenneth J. on count three.  Hearing for other restitution requests.

Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgement:  DNA surcharge on count one, Court waived the DNA surcharges on the other counts due to DNA surcharge on count one.   Court waived all other Court costs due to the amount of restitution to be imposed.
All applicable fees of supervision.
DNA surcharge and restitution:    To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; consecutive to any other other sentence.   Credit for 171 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.  Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 171 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count four; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 171 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count five; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 171 days.

Consecutive to: **12-16-15, Order amending JOC to state zero days sentence credit on count five**
**12/28/2015  Honorable Dennis R. Cimpl-count five is concurrent with counts one through four. Credit of 171 days.

Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Timothy S and Dorothy M
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS..
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
As to Count 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 4; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
As to Count 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 5; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
As to Count 5: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 171 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
All sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
DNA surcharges on Count 1.  Court waived the DNA surcharges on the other counts due to DNA surcharge on Count 1.
Restitution in the amount of $60 to Kenneth J on count  3.  Court schedules a status conference on restitution in Branch 19 for other restitution requests.
Court waived all other court costs  due to the amount of restitution to be imposed
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter or Cash Bail to apply
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Letter from Franklin School District dated 11/5/2015
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

CASE FILE NOT IN COURT.  Attorney Darryl Smith appeared for the defendant Daquan T Sconiers.  Daquan T Sconiers in custody not produced.  State appeared by Patrick Anderson.    Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court adjourned the 10/8/2015 sentencing hearing to 11/5/2015 at 1:30 pm.
Court orders off the record on defense request a PSI report.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 19.  As to Counts 1-5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Daquan Tobias Sconiers in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Patrick Anderson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Christopher Shorts.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 22.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) including drug testing.
